title: The Power of Constant Devotion
sub_title: Tending the Garden of Our Souls
devotional:
Eliza loved tending her small garden. Even in the chill of late winter, tiny sprouts of green promised the bounty to come. One morning, a thick blanket of snow covered everything. Discouraged, Eliza almost didn't bother to clear a path to her beloved plants. "What's the point?" she sighed. "They're probably all frozen under there anyway." But something compelled her to venture out. Carefully, she brushed the snow away, revealing the fragile shoots, miraculously unharmed. Eliza realized then that her devotion, even in the face of apparent futility, had played a part in protecting those delicate plants. Just as she regularly tended to them in fairer weather, her checking in during the difficult season mattered too.

Our devotion to God can feel similar at times. When life is easy, and blessings abound, it's simple to pray, to read scripture, to feel connected. But what about when the 'snow' falls – when difficulties pile up, when prayers seem unanswered, and doubt creeps in? That's when our true devotion is tested. It's easy to let our routines slide, to lose heart. But Eliza's garden reminds us that consistent, unwavering devotion, even when we don't see immediate results, nourishes our relationship with God and sustains us through the storms of life.

Devotion isn't about grand gestures or perfect performance. It's about showing up, day after day, offering what we have – our time, our attention, our prayers – even when it feels difficult or pointless. It's about nurturing the small seeds of faith within us, trusting that God will bring them to fruition in His time. It’s about recognizing that God appreciates small, consistent devotion just as much as grand sweeping acts of worship. It’s about tending our spiritual garden even when it’s cold and covered in snow.

Just as Eliza's consistent care helped her plants survive the unexpected snow, your constant devotion to God will protect and nourish your spirit through life’s unforeseen challenges. Show up today for those small acts of devotion and allow the Lord to grow and prosper you.
image_description: A small snow-covered garden with a single sprout pushing through the snow.
insights: The importance of constant devotion is reflected throughout Scripture. Joshua 1:8 encourages us to meditate on God's word day and night so that we may be careful to do everything written in it. Similarly, 1 Thessalonians 5:16-18 calls us to 'Rejoice always, pray without ceasing, give thanks in all circumstances; for this is the will of God in Christ Jesus for you.' These verses highlight the need for continual engagement with God, not just during times of ease, but in every season of life.
prayer: Heavenly Father, thank you for your unwavering presence in my life, even when I struggle to see You. Help me to cultivate a heart of devotion, to show up consistently in prayer, in scripture, and in service, even when it feels difficult. Strengthen my faith and remind me that my small acts of devotion are meaningful and pleasing to You. Help me be consistent with showing up to you Lord. In Jesus’ name, Amen.
reflection: In what ways can you cultivate a more consistent practice of devotion in your life? What small acts of devotion can you commit to today, even if you don't feel like it? How can you reframe your perspective on the purpose and impact of devotion?
